org.cell2d

Class Music

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cell2d.Music

  • public class Music
extends java.lang.Object

    A Music track is a piece of music that can be played in the background of a CellGame. All playing and stopping of Music tracks is controlled by methods of a CellGame so that the CellGame can keep track of them in its music stack.

    Like Sprites, SpriteSheets, and Sounds, Music tracks can be manually loaded and unloaded into and out of memory. Loading may take a moment, but while a Music track is not loaded, it cannot play.

    Music tracks can be played at different speeds from 0 up, with a speed of 0 pausing the Music track and a speed of 1 causing no speed change. They can also be played at different volumes between 0 and 1, with a volume of 0 making the Music track inaudible and a volume of 1 causing no volume change. Finally, the Music class has a global volume between 0 and 1 by which the effective volumes of all currently playing Music tracks are scaled.

    See Also:
    CellGame

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fadeOut(double duration)
      Instructs the music player to gradually fade this Music track's volume to 0 over the specified duration, stopping this Music track once it is silent, if it is currently playing.

      Instructs the music player to gradually fade this Music track's speed to the specified speed over the specified duration, if this Music track is currently playing.

    • Field Detail

      • BLANK

        public static final Music BLANK
        A blank Music track that produces no sound and plays indefinitely. It is considered to be always looping, never paused, and with a position, speed, and volume of 0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Music

        public Music(java.lang.String path,
             boolean load)
        Constructs a Music track from an audio file. Files of WAV, OGG, and AIF(F) formats are supported. When this Music track is looping, it will return to the start of the track once it reaches the end.
        Parameters:
        path - The relative path to the audio file
        load - Whether this Music track should load upon creation

      • Music

        public Music(java.lang.String path,
             double loopStart,
             double loopEnd,
             boolean load)
        Constructs a Music track from an audio file. Files of WAV, OGG, and AIF(F) formats are supported.
        Parameters:
        path - The relative path to the audio file
        loopStart - The position in seconds in this Music track to which it should return at the start of a loop
        loopEnd - The position in seconds in this Music track that, when reached, causes it to start a new loop if it is looping. If this is negative, this Music track will start a new loop when it reaches the end of the track.
        load - Whether this Music track should load upon creation

        public final boolean isPlaying()

      • getSpeed

        public final double getSpeed()
        Returns the speed at which this Music track is playing, or 0 if it is not currently playing.
        Returns:
        The speed at which this Music track is playing

      • setSpeed

        public final void setSpeed(double speed)
        Sets the speed at which this Music track is playing if it is currently playing. If this Music track's speed is fading, the fade will be interrupted.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed at which this Music track should play

      • fadeSpeed

        public final void fadeSpeed(double speed,
                            double duration)
        Instructs the music player to gradually fade this Music track's speed to the specified speed over the specified duration, if this Music track is currently playing.
        Parameters:
        speed - This Music track's eventual speed
        duration - The fade's duration in seconds

      • getVolume

        public final double getVolume()
        Returns the volume at which this Music track is playing, or 0 if it is not currently playing.
        Returns:
        The volume at which this Music track is playing

        Sets the volume at which this Music track is playing if it is currently playing. If this Music track's volume is fading, the fade will be interrupted.

      • fadeOut

        public final void fadeOut(double duration)
        Instructs the music player to gradually fade this Music track's volume to 0 over the specified duration, stopping this Music track once it is silent, if it is currently playing.
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration in seconds of the fade-out
